title: How is Aristotle's demonstration of pure act the basis for metaphysics? - Quora

response.answer_text: the spirit is made and only exists completely in the mental, the ‘thought’, which is to say, in the physical reality of atom to atom. wording is the metaphysical — after the physical, and at first showing is pure and then decays to ‘what was said’. so, aristotle’s pure act is actually a theatre of cruelty, where the spirit is mentioned and the audience is shamed for not dying to become pure.

I am not sure it is the basis of metaphysics, after all, it is a conclusion based on his analysis of causality and the movement from potentially to actuality. I should think that his notion that relation arises from substance would be the basis. Put another way, Aristotle analyzes being in terms of substance. That would make substance the basis of metaphysics.
